intro: Meranthera collum-cycni, commonly known as the water dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along the edges of ponds and streams. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slight hairy texture. Meranthera collum-cycni is found primarily in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
